job.title: Machine Learning Engineer
job.description:
We’re building fully-electric farm machines for sustainable and regenerative agriculture. We have received a National Science Foundation SBIR grant to do research on computer vision for understanding plant geometry. This is a challenging problem in farm fields where many plants can overlap and occlude one another. We’re looking for a remote software developer to help with building and running the software involved in this research. The grant period is 9 months, but if the project goes well there is a good chance that the work will continue after that.


Requirements:

  • experience with C++
  • experience with Python
  • experience with image processing and/or computer vision algorithms
  • experience with PyTorch and/or TensorFlow
  • based in US


Optional:

  • experience with developing and running machine learning models on AWS
  • experience with OpenCV


To apply: please send a resume along with a link to some C++ and/or Python code that you have written.


Compensation: $117k/year (for 9 months) plus health insurance
